intro: Cheirodendron trigynum f. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cheirodendron, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features include yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The leaves are usually alternate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinct appearance.
